History of malaria in the U.S. any guide to direction of anti-malaria
work? Not easy to improve conditions of life, but education and the like may
help. In the south, at least, one would be pulling with the tide, because
already present a strong tendency to improvement. Anyhow, well to
make clear to a community to what extent their salvation depends
on themselves and that it is not necessary to wait on the State, the Govt.
or the I.H.B. to improve their conditions. Probably generally true
that a people gets the sort of government that it deserves. Is it not
also true that a people (in this country, at least) has about as much malaria as
(of malaria.

Is my own observation generally correct, that a comparatively small
improvement in general social status is followed by a relatively large
diminution in mix malaria? Optimistic, but, I think, generally true.
Yes
You see that there is plenty that one can say on the subject, but
so little definite information as to how much and where the malaria diminution
has occurred and where it has not diminished but increased. I think our obser-
vations on the present status of this region will be about the best part of
the paper. I should much appreciate any guide as to where I could get
more information regarding localities still highly malarious and regarding
economic conditions there.
